chapter.tagline: Unveiling the operation, purpose, and continuity of the anointing in the believer’s life.

questions.a: The anointing is the operation of the Holy Spirit upon and within a person, enabling divine function. It is God’s power manifested for assignment and service.

questions.q: Is the anointing different from the Holy Spirit?
questions.a: The Holy Spirit is the Person; the anointing is His activity. Wherever He works, that manifestation is called the anointing.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the anointing?
questions.a: It equips believers to carry out God’s will—teaching, healing, preaching, leading, and demonstrating kingdom power effectively.

questions.q: Can a believer lose the anointing?
questions.a: The indwelling Spirit never leaves, but His outward operation can be stifled by disobedience or unbelief. Fellowship maintains flow.
By staying filled with the Spirit—through prayer, worship, obedience, and meditating on the Word. The anointing thrives in yielded vessels.

questions.q: Are there levels or measures of the anointing?
questions.a: Yes. Believers grow from measure to fullness. Faithfulness and revelation increase capacity for greater manifestations.

questions.q: What is the difference between being anointed and being gifted?
questions.a: A gift is an ability; the anointing is empowerment. Gifts can function naturally, but anointing gives supernatural effectiveness.

questions.q: Does the anointing rest only on ministers?
questions.a: No. Every believer has an anointing from the Holy One. Ministry offices differ in expression, but all share the same source.
The anointing within illuminates truth to the heart beyond intellect. It makes revelation personal and practical.

questions.q: Why must believers understand the mechanics of the anointing?
questions.a: Because ignorance breeds misuse. Knowing how it operates ensures the believer flows accurately with God and not emotion or hype.
